Case reference: 2012020005.CaseDesc: David Cox was last seen on April 8, 2011 in the Cranbrook, BC area.  He was known to be living a high risk lifestyle. His disappearance is considered suspicious in nature and foul play has not been ruled out.

Case reference: 2014005292.CaseDesc: On December 4, 1992, at approximately 6:30am, Renata Ejsmont was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The day before her disappearance, Renata had quit her job and told her former employer that she was moving back to Poland.

Case reference: 2006019399.CaseDesc: Randall Gunning was last seen on May 5, 1984, in the area of Elliot Lake. Mr. Gunning suffered from depression and was despondent when he left.

Case reference: 2020011470.CaseDesc: On June 25, 1988, at approximately 10:15am, Ian Lewis was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ian had told his younger brother that he had wanted to go to Jamaica.

Case reference: 2021023515.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2015, the remains of an unidentified man were found in a wooded area on Vincent Massey Road in Rawdon, Quebec. Anthropological analysis suggests that he was of Caucasian descent, between the ages of 16 and 25, and that he had died between 1990 and 2010.

Case reference: 2016030649.CaseDesc: Kean Luo was originally from Malaysia, but had moved to the United States to attend school and begin his career. On March 2, 2016 Mr. Luo moved to Winnipeg, Manitoba for work. Friends and family began to worry about Mr. Luo as they were unable to reach him for an extended period of time. However, on April 2, 2016, police spoke with Mr. Luo at a local hotel. Mr. Luo said that he was not feeling suicidal, but was feeling stressed and missing his family. He was last seen on April 2, 2016 on the Sergeant Thomas Cooper bridge with his vehicle parked on the shoulder of the highway. All cell phone and bank activity have ceased.

Case reference: 2014000008.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2008, Christopher Hargitt, a resident of Vernon, BC, drove from Vernon to Vancouver. He was last seen by an associate, who was dropped off by Mr. Hargitt near the PNE Fairgrounds. On March 6, 2008, Christopher's vehicle was found unoccupied in East Vancouver, and he has made no contact with family or friends since that time. It is believed that Christopher may have run afoul of individuals involved in criminal activity, or fled the country to avoid these same persons.

Case reference: 2012020130.CaseDesc:
Mario Marabella, 40 years old, was on his way to a meeting when he was abducted on December 4, 2008 in Laval.  Mr. Marabella was at a service station on Highway 440 between Hwys. 19 and 25 around 4:00 p.m. when three people forced him into a van and fled. 

Mr. Marabella's car, a grey Acura MDX was retrieved around 8:00 p.m. that evening by one or more of the abductors at the same Petro-Canada station from which Mr. Marabella was abducted. A few hours later the car was found burning at the corner of Gouin Boulevard and Lambert St. in Montréal.  Mr. Marabella was known to be involved in organized crime.  He was linked to the Italian Mafia.

Case reference: 2014006160.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1978, George Heys left his residence for an appointment in Toronto, Ontario. George has not been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014005961.CaseDesc: Chris Metallic had been attending a party at a residence in Sackville on Saturday night but was last seen in Sackville at approximately 3 a.m. on Sunday, November 25, 2012. A search for Mr. Metallic focused on a wooded area and river off of Route 940 heading toward Shemogue after information was received that a person was seen walking on the Upper Aboujagne Road around 5:30 a.m. on Sunday morning.

Case reference: 2014001875.CaseDesc: On May 25th, 1987 at approximately 9:00 a.m., Rene Parr left his home in Trois-Rivieres, Quebec, where he was living with his sister for the previous 6 months. He was in the process of a divorce and he was scheduled to attend the courthouse the next day. Rene has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006016999.CaseDesc: Donald Hemsworth was last seen in the area surrounding Twitchgrass and Hilda Lakes, Farr Township on October 8, 1974.

Case reference: 2014002315.CaseDesc: In 1983 Dennis Chubb moved to Winnipeg from God's Lake Narrows.  He was believed to be residing in a rooming house on Furby Street in the Downtown area of Winnipeg.  Dennis was last seen entering this rooming house after having been dropped off by a family member.  It is reported that Dennis moved from this rooming house and into another residence just prior to his disappearance. M. Chubb's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2018063453.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2003, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Senotta Thomas was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. Senotta had left her home to go to work, but did not return home.

Case reference: 2006023699.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Turtle was last seen in Pikangikum in the Squirrel Rock area in Ontario on July 4, 2005. Information received indicated that Mr. Turtle was going to a sand pit area approximately 3 km northwest of Pikangikum.

Case reference: 2020021899.CaseDesc: Nowell HALFE was last seen by family in Edmonton, Alberta in 2013. The last documented occurrence for HALFE puts him in Edmonton, Alberta in January of 2014.

Case reference: 2014006177.CaseDesc: On October 9, 1987, at approximately 9:00 p.m. Phillip Orvis went out onto the lake in his boat from Matheson Island. He was planning to go to his fishing camp at Black Bear Island. At the time that he left the water on the lake was very rough. Phillip could not swim and he was known to never wear a life jacket. His boat was found the next day drifted up against the mainland approximately 1/2 mile south east of the dock where he is believed to have left from. The boat was filled with water. Searches were conducted by land, air and water and dragging operations were conducted on the lake however his body was never located. Phillip Orvis is presumed dead due to drowning and foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2018054176.CaseDesc: On February 15, 1992, at approximately 10:00pm, Adu Frimpong was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004704.CaseDesc: On the morning of March 24, 2000, René Rosa was seen for the last time at his residence in La Minerve, Quebec. On this day, at approximately 2:40 p.m., René’s vehicle, a 1996 purple Chevrolet Cavalier, was found abandoned near Montée Charette in La Minerve. René has not been seen and we have not heard from him since.

Case reference: 2006020299.CaseDesc: Mary Ann Copeman was last seen on September 5, 1993 when she left to go on a recreational walk. Ms. Copeman was known to have mental health issues and may have been in a confused state. She was walking in the vicinity of Fifth Street in Balmertown, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006013699.CaseDesc: Emile Morissette was last seen while on a fishing trip at Birch Lake in Timmins Township, Ontario on July 6, 1976.

Case reference: 2014005328.CaseDesc: In October 1986, Frances Neilson was observed by family leaving her residence in Edmonton, Alberta in the family vehicle. A few days later the vehicle was recovered but Frances has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005385.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Laura Lee Murray. She was last seen in downtown Calgary, Alberta, on June 25, 1992.

Case reference: 2014004419.CaseDesc: Holly Painter was initially reported as a missing person on June 26, 1995. On that evening, two friends of Holly's reported that they were at her residence when an argument broke out between Holly and one of the friends. They said that Holly assaulted that friend; the other friend then took Holly from the residence. All 3 of them left in the second friend's vehicle, with him driving. He reported that he intended to take Holly to her parents' residence, however, while making a left turn at an intersection, she jumped out of the vehicle and ran off.

Case reference: 2015020929.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2015, Andrzej Popek was last seen at the Crawford Lake Conservation Area in Milton, Ontario.  Andrzej's abandoned vehicle was located the following day in the Conservation's parking lot.

Case reference: 2014004009.CaseDesc: On April 7, 1987, Dale Eldridge was seen for the last time as he went down to a river with some of his friends in Peace River, Alberta. Prior to that, Dale had attended a party.

Case reference: 2020006647.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1980, Ophlin Facey was seen for the last time as she left the residence of her employer. During the time of her disappearance, Ophlin was a live-in house keeper, and it is possible she may have been heading to a party that day.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Case reference: 2014002762.CaseDesc: On March 3rd, 1982, Laurence Peterson and Randolph Johanson were reported missing by Mr. Johanson’s girlfriend. Mr. Johanson and Mr. Peterson were last seen on February 28th, 1982, leaving the Shelter Island Marina, on their boats. Mr. Johanson was reportedly using his 26 ft. long salvage tug boat to haul Mr. Peterson’s 43 ft. wooden halibut fishing vessel to Lund, BC. The men were reported missing when they did not arrive at their destination. Extensive searches were unsuccessful. It has been speculated that the two men disappeared to start a new life.

Case reference: 2014002495.CaseDesc: Linda Scott was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in April 2000. Linda was last heard from by a family member in March 2000. She is normally in contact with family at least once a week. Linda was believed to be last seen with friends.

Case reference: 2014006038.CaseDesc: Kimberley Cruickshank was reported missing on March 25, 2013. She was last seen on March 22, 2013 in her apartment on the 2400 Block of Abbott Road in Regina, SK.

Case reference: 2014005541.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2010, Shawn Smith was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. On September 6, Shawn arrived in the Dominican Republic and was scheduled to return on the September 12, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2006028299.CaseDesc: Shawn McConkey was last seen leaving work on December 21, 2001. That same day, his vehicle was involved in a single vehicle collision on County Road #22 in Otonabee-South Monaghan Township. No one was located at the scene of the accident. A search of the area has failed to locate Mr. McConkey and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014004565.CaseDesc: On December 1, 2004, Jack Day left Fort McMurray, Alberta, for an unknown destination. On December 4, 2004, Mr. Day's abandoned vehicle was discovered at Chrystina Lake Provincial Recreational area near Swan Hills, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004987.CaseDesc: On September 6, 2004, Cassandra Wright was seen for the last time leaving the Homewood Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Cassandra said that she would be back in the morning.

Case reference: 2014005806.CaseDesc: Roderic Maynard was last seen on Salt Spring Island, BC.  Mr. Maynard had personal issues and departed the area telling friends he intended on attending rehab for treatment of alcohol abuse.  Mr. Maynard is an avid sailor and has travelled all over the world.  Mr. Maynard was employed operating ferries around the Vancouver/Victoria area and would have no problem finding employment operating large water vessels or sail boats.  He is familiar with sailing all around the world and planned to retire in the St. Maarten area.

Case reference: 2012020646.CaseDesc: Antonie Medzech was last seen outside the Midtown Plaza in downtown Saskatoon, SK at approximately 8:00 a.m. on December 13, 2002. Mrs. Medzech had been dropped off at that location to go shopping.

Case reference: 2016068704.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1966, a female was recovered from the water near Amherstburg. Death is believed to have occurred within a few hours to a couple of days prior to recovery.

Case reference: 2008015399.CaseDesc: Ronald Desmeules was living in Red Lake, Ontario. While working through some personal issues, Mr. Desmeules traveled to Squamish, British Columbia in September of 1995. On September 14, 1995, while staying with family, he left their residence, and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2005069040.CaseDesc: Yaseen is believed to be with his mother, Marina Zlonikova. They may be in the Ukraine.

Case reference: 2006017499.CaseDesc: Michael McIntyre was last seen on April 7, 1994 at his home on Round Lake in Hagarty Township, approximately 10 km northwest of Killaloe, On. An extensive land search and follow up to leads have proved negative. Mr. McIntyre is formerly from Fort McMurray, Alberta. He came to live in Round Lake in December of 1993. He is an avid outdoor sportsman.

Case reference: 1994001800.CaseDesc: On the evening of August 5, 1989, Casey Bohun was seen for the last time by her mother when she was put to bed in her home in Delta, British Columbia. Prior to her disappearance, Casey and her family had recently moved to this area, and she was not familiar with the neighbourhood. Today, Casey may not realize that she was abducted as a child.

Case reference: 2016061073.CaseDesc: On July 13, 1980, the remains of a male was recovered from the Niagara River Whirlpool. His post-mortem length was measured at 5'9"; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he has been in the water for possibly 2 weeks.

Case reference: 2014003711.CaseDesc: Between May 25 and June 2, 1978, Gerry Maurice Gascon received the services of the Algoma Hospital in the City of Greater Sudbury. He has not been in contact with anyone since his release from Algoma Hospital.  Gerry usually wears blue jeans, a black leather jacket and cowboy boots.

Case reference: 2014003550.CaseDesc: Kenneth James Schmit, who went by "Jimmy", was last seen leaving a social gathering at a home in St. Walburg, SK, at 10:30 p.m. on September 22, 1966. Mr. Schmit was despondent, and, at the time of his disappearance, had a heavy beard. Numerous searches of the area were conducted, however, Mr. Schmit was not located.

Case reference: 2018063446.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1990, Ian MacKay was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Ian’s brother had not heard from him in three years before he reported him missing.

Case reference: 2006024299.CaseDesc: Harold Cottrell was last seen on September 28, 1984, in a boat on Northwind Lake.  It is believed the aluminum boat he was travelling in with some companions, was overloaded.  The boat began to sink.  Mr. Cottrell was never located and is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014001077.CaseDesc: On February 27, 1974, the remains of a small, middle aged Indigenous man were found collapsed on Alexander Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had no natural teeth and had a star-like scar on his left wrist.

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Case reference: 2014002260.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1993, William Kacuiba was operating a snow machine on the North Saskatchewan river near Prince Albert, SK. His snow machine went through open ice and searches of the water and area, including air searches, failed to locate his body.

Case reference: 2016018567.CaseDesc: Mekayla was last seen at the STC Bus Depot in Yorkton at 1:45 p.m. on April 12, 2016. She went to school in the morning, but left shortly after arriving. She went to several businesses in Yorkton throughout the morning, then returned to school around noon. She bought lunch at the restaurant in the bus depot, but did not get on a bus that day. Mekayla left the bus depot in the early afternoon and hasn't been seen since.

Case reference: 2018039090.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1996, at approximately 10:00 a.m., San Lee was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, San was terminally ill and despondent.

Case reference: 2008005099.CaseDesc: On January 26, 1976, Robert McDonald’s employer advised that he had not shown up for work and had not been seen since January 16, 1976. On January 28, 1976 it was reported that Mr. McDonald was seen hitchhiking south out of Ear Falls on Highway 105. Mr. McDonald has not been seen since. He was 33 years old at the time of his disappearance and was last seen at Griffith Mines, north of Ear Falls, ON.

Case reference: 2014001088.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from the Whirlpool of the Niagara River, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His eye colour is believed to be brown. He was recovered without clothing.

Case reference: 2014001072.CaseDesc: On July 19 1984, the body of a male believed to be between the ages of 18-29 was found in the waters of the Fraser River near Boston Bar, British Columbia. He had some crowding on his upper teeth and no tattoos or obvious scars. It is believed he was deceased for a few months prior to his remains being recovered.

Case reference: 2016065648.CaseDesc: On April 6, 1968, skeletal remains were located at the base of a 50 foot cliff on the bank of the lower Niagara River, Niagara Falls. A pair of boots was located with the remains.

Case reference: 2012020068.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1996 Winston Redhead's father reported that he had not heard from his son since December 21, 1995.  Winston's brother advised that Winston indicated he would be home for Christmas.  The last contact with Winston was made by staff at the Main Street Project in Winnipeg on December 26, 1995.  He told staff there that he would be going back up north. Winston has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014002675.CaseDesc: Richard Monroe was last seen on October 2nd, 2001 by the owners of Serge's Restaurant on Elgin Street in the city of Greater Sudbury. Richard is believed to have suffered from dementia. He spent most of his time in Thessalon, Sault Ste. Marie, Dunn's Valley, Sudbury and British Columbia.

Case reference: 2006013999.CaseDesc: Walter Glynn was last seen July 23, 1980 walking southbound on Main Street, Kirkland Lake.  Mr. Glynn was heading to the A&P grocery store at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014002218.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1977, Arthur Roy was seen for the last time, at approximately 1400hrs, when he left his home on foot in North Bay, Ontario. Mr. Roy was suffering from a mental illness and was believed to be senile due to old age.

Case reference: 2011000699.CaseDesc: On 23 May 1985, William Drake walked out of the Pinecrest Home for senior citizens, where he lived.  He was last seen at 9:30 am walking eastbound on highway 17 in Kenora, near the Sunset Husky gas station.  His family and friends have not heard from him since. Mr. Drake is reported to be hard of hearing and diabetic.

Case reference: 2014003425.CaseDesc: Christopher Giberson, went missing from the Saint John Regional Hospital on Friday, January 28th, 2000, at 7:00 p.m. where he was taken for treatment and then assessment, but he walked away before being seen by staff.

Case reference: 2013000005.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2009, Jody Hockett was reported missing to the Grande Prairie RCMP. Jody had been partying at a friend's apartment on February 22, 2009. She left the party and was expected to return.  She was last seen getting into an older, white car in the downtown area of Grande Prairie sometime later that night, or the early morning hours of February 23, 2009. Jody was known to lead a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2020008550.CaseDesc: On November 22, 1984, Anita Tamboom was seen for the last time by her neighbour in Toronto, Ontario. Anita was known to frequently leave her home for extended periods, but she would always return. During the time of her disappearance, Anita was suffering from some mental health issues, and her purse was located on the shores of Lake Ontario.

Case reference: 2014032043.CaseDesc:
On May 22nd, 1970, Philomena Sisson, age 68, was reported missing by her son, Harry Jack.  She had gone missing a few days earlier from his house on Boys Rd. in Duncan, BC.  Mrs. Sisson was reported to be an alcoholic who occasionally went missing for several days at a time. She also suffered from dementia. 
 
Mrs. Sisson's last surviving son has since passed away.  There was never any indication of foul play in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2017060465.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2017, Jesse Clint Galganov was seen for the last time when he took a flight to Peru from the Montréal-Pierre-Elliott Trudeau Airport in Montreal, Quebec. On September 28, 2017, Jesse contacted his mother to tell her that he was going to go hiking for a few days in the forest. Since this time, Jesse has not been seen nor has he contacted his family to provide them with his whereabouts which is contrary to his habits.

Case reference: 1994001630.CaseDesc: Amber Potts was last seen in her hometown of Etobicoke, Ontario when she was 16 years old. She has a history of running away, however she always kept in touch with family or friends. She had been staying in a hotel, but she left behind all her personal belongings and hasn't been seen since. Amber had substance abuse issues.

Case reference: 2014002108.CaseDesc: Craig Waldum along with 7 others were on a canoeing expedition along the Nelson River. Craig was one of two guides on the expedition. On August 18, 1978, three members of the expedition were on shore guiding in a canoe. The remaining 5 members including Craig remained in the canoe. As these individuals labored to guide the canoe to shore, the rope was given some slack. This caused the bow of the canoe to turn out into the current, which in turn caused the canoe to tip. The individuals on shore were unable to hold onto the rope due to the strength of the current and the canoe was carried downstream. Craig hung onto the canoe for a couple hours then was seen letting go. He slipped under the water and did not resurface. Mr. Waldum's remains have not been recovered and foul play is not suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2015059939.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from the water near the Fleet Street Pumping Station, Ottawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 170-180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  It is estimated that he had been in the water between 2 and 3 months.

Case reference: 2006012699.CaseDesc: John James Semple lived in a retirement home on Yearly Road, Huntsville, Ontario.  He was last seen in Huntsville in January 1998.

Case reference: 2012020169.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, the skeletal remains of a man were found in the water at the Reed Point Marina in Port Moody, British Columbia. The man had significant osteoarthritis in his neck and back. He may have been from Alberta and is estimated to have died more than a year prior to discovery.

Case reference: 2014004950.CaseDesc: On June 5, 2007, Kim Rogelstad was reported missing from Coquitlam, British Columbia. However, Kim's family has not seen or heard from her since May 27, 2007.

Case reference: 2012020024.CaseDesc: On February 24, 1995 what appeared to be a partial skull with an attached vertebra was located near a creek; just south of Highway 7, approximately 800 metres east of the Ruskin Bridge in Mission, B.C.  A DNA profile confirmed that this person was a female, and her DNA profile has been provided to every laboratory in Canada and shared with Interpol.  In August 2002, bones recovered during a search of a farm associated to Robert Pickton were confirmed to be genetically linked to this partial skull.  It is possible that this woman's family does not know that she is missing or may be under the mistaken belief that she was reported missing and there is a file open.

Case reference: 2020040389.CaseDesc: On December 15, 1947, Rosella DeLong was seen for the last time leaving her family home in Toronto, Ontario. Rosella intended on travelling to the USA to take a course and to buy equipment to start a weight loss clinic.

Case reference: 2014006235.CaseDesc: A lake freighter capsized in a violent storm on Lake Winnipeg, just north of Hecla Island, Manitoba. The vessel carried nine crew members and one passenger. There was only one survivor who managed to float on a piece of the wreckage to safety. All of the bodies of the remaining occupants were recovered with the exception of Allan Clemens and Tache Everett who were never located. Autopsies confirmed that the causes of death for those recovered were either drowning or death due to exposure in the cold water. Mr. Clemens and Mr. Everett are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014005435.CaseDesc: Although it is unconfirmed, acquaintances of Douglas Scott Renz indicate that he may have left the Chilliwack area in early 2009.  Mr. Renz last had contact with friends in the Chilliwack area in February of 2010, they reported him missing that April.

Case reference: 2014005592.CaseDesc: The Timmins Police Service is actively investigating a historical missing person case involving the disappearance of William “Billy” Chookomolin. Mr. Chookomolin went missing from Timmins in the spring of 1995 at the age of 47.

Case reference: 2014003363.CaseDesc: At 2:00 a.m. on April 21st, 1992, Hilda BEAUDOIN and her brother left the Beagle Lounge in Mary's Harbour, NL on a single snowmobile to ride across the sea ice near coastal waters in efforts to return to St. Lewis, NL. They did not arrive at their destination. Snowmobile tracks were discovered leading into open water near St. Lewis where the snowmobile and her brother's body were later recovered from the ocean waters.

Case reference: 2006021399.CaseDesc: On June 28, 2000, Charles Siljander was last seen at the Marina Park in Thunder Bay, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance reports state that Charles appeared to be confused, forgetful, and that he had lost a significant amount of weight. On September 15, 2000, Charles’ abandoned vehicle, a grey 1981 Chevy pickup truck, was located on a logging road south of Thunder Bay, and near the Canadian and American border.

Case reference: 2020009613.CaseDesc: On March 6, 1989, Marcelo Onorato was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Marcelo was visiting from Argentina and was due to return there on March 12, but he never boarded his flight.

Case reference: 2006020599.CaseDesc: Simon Angeconeb was last seen on July 10, 1993 at Cat Island Lodge located on Red Lake in the District of Kenora, Ontario. He was heading to his cabin to go to sleep and has not been seen since. Mr. Angeconeb may have been suffering from a concussion.

Case reference: 2014006186.CaseDesc: In 2003, Jack Gichuru Gatari last spoke to his sister and told her he was going to Toronto, Ontario, to find work. Jack had come to Canada in 1999 on a student visa to attend the University of Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014003667.CaseDesc: On May 23, 1996, at approximately 7:30 p.m., Kevin Lotysz was seen for the last time as he left the McKellar Hospital in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Kevin is an avid drummer and enjoys music.

Case reference: 2014004087.CaseDesc: On October 31, 1996, James Withers was last seen at his family's residence.

Case reference: 2006010299.CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.

Case reference: 2017062421.CaseDesc: Matthew Wiinikainen was seen for the last time on March 30, 1995 in Gaspé, Quebec. Matthew was in detention at the Youth Center “Unité La Rade”, located in Gaspé hospital area, Quebec. He escaped around 11:00 p.m. during the change of the guard.

Case reference: 2011002299.CaseDesc: On March 24, 1991, four-year-old Michael Dunahee went missing from an area of the playground at Blanshard Elementary School in Victoria, British Columbia.  At the time of his disappearance, Michael was at the playground with his mother, father, and younger sister.

Case reference: 2014004957.CaseDesc: On New Year's Eve, 2002 an anonymous letter was received by the Vancouver Police Department. The letter referred to a female Vancouver sex trade worker who had disappeared one month earlier, at the end of November. The letter writer described the woman, admitted to killing her, and apologized to her family for taking her life. Investigators believe the letter writer was referring to Danielle Marissa Larue, and while her body has never been found, they believe that she was murdered. The letter writer knows what happened to Danielle, and police are hopeful that the writer will contact them again.

Case reference: 2008015599.CaseDesc: In late February 2006 William "Billy" Mason of Hamilton Ontario went missing. An extensive investigation has been conducted by the Hamilton Police Service but William Mason has not been seen or heard from since.  It is known that Billy Mason was murdered shortly after he went missing. The responsible person was convicted of his killing but Billy Mason's remains have not been recovered.

Case reference: 2014002875.CaseDesc: Edmond Belliveau was last seen on Oct 1, 1985, in Saint John, NB.

Case reference: 2022001276.CaseDesc: On December 31, 2021, Emily Bailey was seen for the last time in Hamilton, Ontario. Emily is known to live a transient lifestyle, but is also known to remain in constant contact with her friends and family via social media. All of her social media activity has stopped since December 27, 2021.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2020007818.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1972, at approximately 12:00pm, Harvey Tulley was seen for the last time by the building’s superintendent in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Harvey was despondent.

Case reference: 2014002295.CaseDesc: James Caraley went mountain climbing on Mount Andromeda, Alberta and never returned.  Police and Parks searches were negative.

Case reference: 2012020648.CaseDesc: Andrew Wiebe went missing from his residence in Saskatoon, SK on January 11, 1988. The vehicle he was driving at the time of his disappearance was later located abandoned in the Anglin Lake District, SK.

Case reference: 2012020661.CaseDesc: Darlene Anderson was last seen leaving the Hantleman Building at the Royal University Hospital in Saskatoon on November 6, 2006 at 8:00 pm.

Case reference: 2012020647.CaseDesc:
Ricky Riopel was reported missing in August 2010 by family members who had not seen or heard from him since December 2008. It was later established that Mr. Riopel had been in Moose Jaw at a health care facility in October 2009.   
Investigators now believe the last confirmed sighting of Mr. Riopel was in Saskatoon, at a downtown shopping mall, in September 2010. Mr. Riopel's parents are both failing in health which has prompted this additional request for public assistance.

Case reference: 2019012891.CaseDesc: Dean Brett Todd was last seen by his brother, around Easter time in 2000, near First Memorial Services Kamloops (formerly Schoening Funeral Home) on Tranquille Road in Kamloops, British Columbia. Dean had been invited to dinner, but did not show up. Dean is known to travel between Kamloops and Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005346.CaseDesc: In August of 1987, Dale Sinclair was last seen as he left his home in Edmonton, Alberta, driving his wife’s vehicle. Dale had planned to cash a cheque at the bank, and then intended on visiting family in Gibbons, Alberta. On August 12, 1987, the vehicle he was driving was recovered by the police in Regina, Saskatchewan.
